Title:
Comparison between Tuber gennadii and T. oligospermum
lineages reveals the existence of the new species T. cistophilum
(Tuberaceae, Pezizales)
Abstract:
The genus Tuber P. Micheli ex F.H. Wigg is one of the best
known lineages of hypogeous ascomycetes. It is currently thought to be
formed of at least 9-11 clades and more than 180 different species
(Bonito et al., 2010b; Kinoshita et al., 2011). However, many
taxonomical problems still exist. One of them deals with the often
confused species Tuber gennadii, T. asa and T. oligospermum, all of them
occurring in the Mediterranean basin. The purpose of the current study
is to obtain morphological, ecological and molecular data of new
collections of these species to ascertain their most probable
phylogenetic relationships. To this end, these species were compared
with some others frequently found in the same or similar habitats of the
Mediterranean basin, such as Tuber borchii and T. puberulum.
